info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:54PM MDT until July 31 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN RIO ARRIBA AND NORTHEASTERN SANDOVAL COUNTIES... At 854 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Santa Clara Creek, Rio del Oso, Arroyo del Ojitos, Lower Rio Ojo Caliente. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Espanola, Santa Clara Pueblo, Velarde, Embudo, Chili, Hernandez, Chamita, Medanales, Alcalde, Ohkay Owingeh Pueblo, La Villita and Lyden. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 337 and 351. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
